Subject Title: A History of International Development in Asia: The Role of Engineers and Designers

Description: This course delves into the science and engineering of advanced energy conversion systems, focusing on efficiency and innovation. Topics include thermodynamic cycles, combustion engines, fuel cells, and nuclear energy systems. Students will explore cutting-edge technologies to optimize energy conversion in industrial and commercial settings. Practical exercises will involve analyzing system performance, troubleshooting inefficiencies, and proposing designs for next-generation energy conversion solutions. While sustainability is touched on as part of the broader discussion, the course primarily emphasizes technical optimization and energy efficiency rather than environmental considerations.

Subject Title: Artificial Intelligence for Creative Problem Solving
Description: This course explores the use of artificial intelligence to address complex, creative challenges across various domains. Students will study generative models, natural language processing, and AI-driven design tools to develop innovative solutions. Through project-based learning, participants will create AI applications that tackle problems in areas such as art, design, and education.

Subject Title: Business Culture and Entrepeneurship in China

Description: This course examines the role of media in shaping cultural narratives and global identities. Students will analyze the impact of films, social media, and journalism on societal perceptions, exploring themes such as representation, bias, and globalization. Through discussions and media projects, students will develop critical insights into the power of media as a tool for cultural influence.

Description: This course explores sustainable design principles in architecture and urban planning, emphasizing the integration of green technologies and materials into building design. Students will learn about eco-friendly construction techniques, renewable energy systems for urban spaces, and strategies for reducing carbon footprints in urban environments. Case studies and design workshops will provide hands-on experience in creating sustainable urban solutions.

Subject Title: High Performance Computing in Science and Engineering

History of Traditional Chinese Short Fiction
Imagine Dragons: Monsters and Outcasts in Literature, from Beowulf to Murakami
Interventions in Design, Technology, and Society

Description: This course focuses on the application of machine learning techniques to enhance cybersecurity. Students will learn about threat detection, anomaly analysis, and predictive modeling for identifying and mitigating security risks. The course includes hands-on projects to develop machine learning algorithms for detecting phishing, malware, and unauthorized access in network systems.

Subject Title: Modern China: Pluralism, and Beyond Territoriality
Modernism: Technology and Society in Architecture
Principles of Logistics and Operational Skills

Description: This course explores the principles and applications of renewable energy systems, including solar, wind, hydro, and bioenergy technologies. Students will gain insights into designing and implementing energy solutions that minimize environmental impact and promote sustainable development. Topics include energy storage, system integration, and the role of renewable technologies in transitioning to a greener future. Hands-on projects will allow students to analyze real-world energy systems and develop innovative solutions to meet growing energy demands sustainably.

Subject Title: Sages Through The Ages: Readings in Early Indian and Chinese Religion and Philosophy
Science of Sound: Acoustics, Audio & Music
Shaping Futures: Innovation, Work and Society
Social Science: Understanding Behaviour, Culture & Society

Description: This course provides an introduction to systems thinking and its application to operational processes in organizations. Students will explore techniques for analyzing complex systems, identifying bottlenecks, and optimizing performance. Topics include process mapping, lean systems, and strategic decision-making. Practical exercises and real-world case studies will prepare students to address operational challenges in diverse industries.
